definitions.text: a matrix formed by interchanging the rows and columns of a given matrix
change the order or arrangement of
examples: Dyslexics often transpose letters in a word

definitions.text: transfer from one place or period to another
examples: The ancient Greek story was transplanted into Modern America
interchange this screw for one of a smaller size

definitions.text: transfer a quantity from one side of an equation to the other side reversing its sign, in order to maintain equality
put (a piece of music) into another key
exchange positions without a change in value
examples: These operators commute with each other
Can you transpose this fugue into G major?
